content.webTitle: The life and times of Juan Antonio Samaranch

fields.headline: The life and times of Juan Antonio
fields.bodyText: Born: 17 July 1920, Barcelona Joined IOC: 1966. Elected its seventh president in 1980. Defining moments:  China and South Africa reintegrated into the Olympics. China returned after a 32-year absence to the 1984 games; South Africa came back in 1992 after the ending of apartheid.  The number of sports in the summer Olympics increased from 21 in Moscow in 1980 to 28 in Sydney last year.  Shamateurism was abolished and the Olympics were opened to professionals.  Only one city (Los Angeles) bid for the 1984 Olympics; 10 cities submitted candidacies for the 2008 games.  Over the past 20 years, the IOC has had TV and sponsorship deals worth more than $12bn (£8.5bn).  The 1984 Soviet-led boycott of Los Angeles left the future of the games in doubt.  The 1998 Salt Lake City bribery scandal exposed widespread IOC corruption and almost forced him to step down.
